text: [Music]

hi I'm Alfred a cloud support engineer
here at the AWS office in Sydney today
I'm going to show you how to resolve the
cross slot keys in the request that do
not hash to the same slot error when you
use multi key operations on Amazon
elastic cache radius cluster that has
got cluster mode enabled let's get
started
the cross slot error occurs when the
keys that you're trying to operate on
aren't hashed to the same slot even
though you might store them on the same
node for example let's say we have two
keys my set and my set 2 stored on the
same
node now if we try to perform a multi
key operation such as s union on these
sets we get the cross slot error because
the keys are hashed to different slots
to verify let's run the cluster key slot
command to resolve this issue we can use
hashtags to force the keys into the same
hashot when a key contains the hashtag
open braces uniform string close braces
only the substring between the braces is
used to compute the hashot
from the commands output we can see that
both the keys are part of the same hash
slot now let's add values to the two
keys using the command to the same slot
using hashtag
method to verify that the multi key
operation succeeds let's run the s union
command
when you use the open braces user one
closed braces prefix both keys hash to
the same slot allowing you to use multi
key operations so that's how you can
resolve the cross slot error when you
use multi key operations on elastic
radius cluster that has cluster mode
enabled thanks for watching and happy
cloud computing from all of us here at
AWS
[Applause]
[Music]
[Music]
